intro: Cyanea lobata subsp. lobata, commonly known as the Hawaiian lobata, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and mesic shrublands. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, attracting various pollinators like bees and flies. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
